Today I introduced a bill to prohibit the Bureau of Prisons from charging fees for room and board at halfway houses. BOP feeds and houses inmates in prisons and halfway houses. Imposing additional burdens on returning citizens sets them up to fail.

Thank you @HRC for endorsing my bill that expressly prohibits discrimination against LGBTQ jurors in local DC courts! DC has strong nondiscrimination laws, but under the Home Rule Act, only Congress can bar discrimination against jurors in DC.

With Democratic control of the House, I will also continue to push to remove anti-home rule provisions preventing DC from commercializing recreational marijuana use. Congress has no business interfering with DC local government. #HandsOffDC

Yesterday I introduced a bill to permit marijuana use in federal housing in states where marijuana use is legal. No American should fear eviction for using a legal substance in their state. It’s time Congress catch up with the American people.

Despite no collusion findings, the #MuellerReport indicated many contacts between the Trump campaign and the Russians. Campaigns should be obligated to report all interactions with foreign governments. I am a cosponsor of a bill that would do just that.

The Mueller Report documents abundant evidence of obstruction of justice but Justice Department guidance bars Mueller from moving further. Congress is not a law enforcement body, but nothing keeps Congress from investigating whether the president obstructed justice.

Outstanding questions of obstruction of justice by the President are more outstanding than ever following Barr’s defensive press conference. Barr concedes “10 episodes” involving the president. Congress must decide if the president interfered.

Happy #DCEmancipationDay! DC's slaves were freed nine months before the Emancipation Proclamation, but the point of April 16th is that, 218 years later, DC residents are neither fully free or equal. We must fight for #DCstatehood.

Democrats are not waiting for Trump’s tax returns to probe his finances. We also are seeking information from other sources, such as Deutsche Bank and Trump’s own accountants. They can’t stonewall Congress.

Heading into our #DCEmancipationDay celebration, our #DCstatehood bill (HR 51) now has a record 203 House cosponsors! Thank you to Members who recognize that American citizens who pay taxes are due representation.

Remember to file with the IRS by April 15. You may think you don’t need to file a tax return because of your income, but you may be missing benefits like the Earned Income Tax Credit, which means the government may owe you money. April 15 is this Monday, the filing deadline.

Speaking again on the House floor for #DCstatehood and DC’s celebration of Emancipation Day, April 16th. Lincoln freed the slaves in DC first, but DC residents are the last Americans yet to be fully free. #FreeAndEqualDC

Today I introduced a bill to ban discrimination against LGBTQ jurors in the local DC court. DC juries should not be deprived of the service of LGBTQ residents and they should be able to serve. Until DC is given control over its courts, Congress must pass this LGBTQ equality bill.

157 years later, D.C. residents are not yet fully free or equal. Congress can overturn the local laws of the District and imposes federal taxes on D.C. residents without residents receiving representation in their government. This must change. #DCstatehood

But I’ll also be speaking about 21st century freedom for DC residents, #DCstatehood. DC is not yet fully free and equal until we have full self-government and congressional representation. #FreeAndEqualDC
I’ll soon speak on the House floor in honor of the upcoming DC #EmancipationDay, when slaves in the nation’s capital were freed nine months before the Emancipation Proclamation.

Today is #EqualPayDay – to insist on equal pay for women and men for doing the same jobs. My Fair Pay Act, introduced today, updates the Equal Pay Act to also demand that women and men doing comparable jobs be paid equally.
